delivering across all aspects of our business. These results reflect healthy consumer spending and ongoing solid demand for our value-added services and solutions, where net revenue increased 18%, or 19% on a currency-neutral basis,&#8221; said Michael Miebach, Mastercard CEO. &#8220;We continue to invest in our suite of differentiated services to grow our addressable market, protect the ecosystem and add value in every transaction. This includes the planned acquisitions of Recorded Future and Minna Technologies, which are expected to add leading AI-powered threat intelligence and subscription management capabilities to meet the needs of our customers.&#8221;</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#f26522;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">The following information is provided to aid in understanding Mastercard&#8217;s third quarter 2024 results, versus the year ago period. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.42pt">Net revenue increased 13%, or 14% on a currency-neutral basis. The increase was attributable to growth in our payment network and our value-added services and solutions.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:14.78pt">Payment network net revenue increased 10%, or 11% on a currency-neutral basis. Primary drivers of the increase were as follows&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.64pt">Gross dollar volume growth of 10%, on a local currency basis, to $2.5&#160;trillion.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.64pt">Cross-bo</font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">rder volume growt</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">h of 17% on a local currency basis. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.64pt">Switched transactions growth of 11%.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">This increase in payment network net revenue includes growth in payment network rebates and incentives provided to customers. Payment network rebates and incentives increased 17%, or 19% on a currency-neutral basis, primarily due to an increase in our key drivers as well as new and renewed deals. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#9642;</font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:14.78pt">Value-added service</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">s and solutions net revenue increased 18%, or 19% on a currency-neutral basis. The increase was dr</font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">i</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">ven primarily by growth in our underlying key drivers, strong demand for our consulting and marketing services, the scaling of our fraud and security and our identity and authentication solutions, and pricing. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.42pt">Total operating expenses increased 25%, or 12% excluding the impact of Third Quarter Special Items. The increase in as-reported operating expenses was primarily due to higher general and administrative expenses (including a restructuring charge in the third quarter of 2024) and litigation provisions. The increase in adjusted operating expenses was primarily due to higher general and administrative expenses.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.42pt">Other income (expense) was unfavorable $55&#160;million versus the year ago period, primarily due to unrealized fair market value adjustments on marketable equity securities. Adjusted other income (expense) was favorable $3&#160;million versus the prior year.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.42pt">The effective tax rate for the third</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%"> quarter of 2024 was 15.6%, versus 15.0% for the comparable period in 2023. The adjusted effective tax rate for the third quarter of 2024 was 16.3%, versus 15.0% for the comparable period in 2023. Both the as-reported and as-adjusted effective tax rates were higher than the prior year rates primarily due to our ability in 2023 to claim more U.S. foreign tax credits generated in 2022 and 2023, partially offset by the establishment of a valuation allowance in 2023 as well as a change in our geographic mix of earnings in the current period. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.42pt">As of September&#160;30, 2024, the Company&#8217;s customers had issued 3.4 billion Mastercard and Maestro-branded cards.</font></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><table style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">The following information is provided to aid in understanding Mastercard&#8217;s year-to-date 2024 results, versus the year ago period.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.42pt">Net revenue increased 11%, or 12% on a currency-neutral basis. The increase was attributable to growth in our payment network and our value-added services and solutions. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:14.78pt">Payment network net revenue increased 8%, or 9% on a currency-neutral basis. Primary drivers of the increase were as follows&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.64pt">Gross dollar volume growth of 10%, on a local currency basis, to $7.2&#160;trillion.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.64pt">Cross-border volume growth of 17% on a local currency basis. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.64pt">Switched transactions growth of 11%.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">This increase in payment network net revenue includes growth in payment network rebates and incentives provided to customers. Payment network rebates and incentives increased 17%, or 18% on a currency-neutral basis, primarily due to an increase in our key drivers as well as new and renewed deals. </font></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:100.000%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.087%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.087%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.526%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"><div><img alt="mclogoa03a.jpg" src="mclogoa03a.jpg" style="height:21px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:34px"></div></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><div style="text-align:right"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">3</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:54pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:14.78pt">Value-added services and solutions net revenue increased 17%, as reported and on a currency-neutral basis. The increase was dr</font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">iv</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">en primarily by growth in our underlying key drivers, strong demand for our consulting and marketing services, and the scaling of our fraud and security and our identity and authentication solutions.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.42pt">Total operating expenses increased 14%, primarily due to higher general and administrative expenses (including a restructuring charge in the third quarter of 2024) and litigation provisions. Excluding the impact of Year-to-date Special Items, adjusted operating expenses increased 10%, both as adjusted and on a currency-neutral basis, primarily due to higher general and administrative expenses.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.42pt">Other income (expense) was favorable $37&#160;million versus the year ago period, primarily due to an increase in investment income and lower net losses related to unrealized fair market value adjustments on marketable and nonmarketable equity securities, partially offset by increased interest expense related to our debt portfolio. Adjusted other income (expense) was favorable $12&#160;million versus the prior year, primarily due to an increase in investment income, partially offset by increased interest expense related to our debt portfolio.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.42pt">The effective tax rate for year-to-date 2024 was 16.1%, versus 18.6% for the comparable period in 2023. The adjusted effective tax rate for year-to-date 2024 was 16.6%, versus 19.0% for the comparable period in 2023. Both the as-reported and as-adjusted effective tax rates were lower than the prior year rates primarily due to the establishment of a valuation allowance in 2023, partially offset by our ability in 2023 to claim more U.S. foreign tax credits generated in 2022 and 2023. Additionally, a change in our geographic mix of earnings in 2024 contributed to the lower effective income tax rate compared to the prior year.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Return of Capital to Shareholders</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">During the third quarter of 2024, Masterca</font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">rd repurc</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">hased 6.3 million shares at a cost of $2.9&#160;billion and paid $611 million in dividends. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">Through September&#160;30, 2024, Mastercard repurchased 16.5 million shares at a cost of $7.6&#160;billion and paid $1.8 billion in dividends.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">Quarter-to-date through October&#160;28, the Company repurchased 2.0&#160;million shares at a cost of $983&#160;million, which leaves $5.6&#160;billion remaining under the approved share repurchase programs. </font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:100.000%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.087%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.087%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.526%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"><div><img alt="mclogoa03a.jpg" src="mclogoa03a.jpg" style="height:21px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:34px"></div></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><div style="text-align:right"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">9</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><div id="i037ebf294b804c618b812f68ad5038ff_13"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:49.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Non-GAAP Financial Information</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">Mastercard discloses the following non-GAAP financial measures&#58; adjusted operating expenses, adjusted operating margin, adjusted other income (expense), adjusted effective income tax rate, adjusted net income and adjusted diluted earnings per share (as well as related applicable growth rates versus the comparable period in the prior year). As described more fully below, these non-GAAP financial measures exclude the impact of gains and losses on the Company&#8217;s equity investments which includes mark-to-market fair value adjustments, impairments and gains and losses upon disposition, as well as the related tax impacts. These non-GAAP financial measures also exclude the impact of special items, where applicable, which represent litigation judgments and settlements and certain one-time items, as well as the related tax impacts. The Company excludes these special items because management evaluates the underlying operations and performance of the Company separately from these recurring and nonrecurring items.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">In addition, the Company presents growth rates adjusted for the impact of currency, which is a non-GAAP financial measure. Currency-neutral growth rates are calculated by remeasuring the prior period&#8217;s results using the current period&#8217;s exchange rates for both the translational and transactional impacts on operating results, as well as removing the related impact of the Company&#8217;s foreign exchange derivative contracts designated as cash flow hedging instruments (specifically those that manage the impact of foreign currency variability on anticipated revenues and expenses). The impact of currency translation represents the effect of translating operating results where the functional currency is different from the Company&#8217;s U.S. dollar reporting currency. The impact of the transactional currency represents the effect of converting revenue and expenses occurring in a currency other than the functional currency of the entity. The impact of the related realized gains and losses resulting from the Company&#8217;s foreign exchange derivative contracts designated as cash flow hedging instruments (specifically those that manage the impact of foreign currency variability on anticipated revenues and expenses) is recognized in the respective financial statement line item on the statement of operations when the underlying forecasted transactions impact earnings. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">The Company believes that the non-GAAP financial measures presented facilitate an understanding of operating performance and provide a meaningful comparison of its results between periods. The Company&#8217;s management uses non-GAAP financial measures to, among other things, evaluate its ongoing operations in relation to historical results, for internal planning and forecasting purposes and in the calculation of performance-based compensation. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">The Company includes reconciliations of the requisite non-GAAP financial measures to the most directly comparable GAAP financial measures. The presentation of non-GAAP financial measures should not be relied upon as substitutes for the Company&#8217;s measures calculated in accordance with GAAP.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="height:49.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">Gains and Losses on Equity Investments</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">1.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Q3&#8217;24 and Q3&#8217;23 net pre-tax losses of $62 million and $6 million, respectively, were primarily related to unrealized fair market value adjustments on marketable equity securities.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:13.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">Third Quarter Special Items</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">2.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Q3&#8217;24 pre-tax charges of $176 million were primarily as a result of a change in estimate related to the claims of merchants who opted out of the U.S. merchant class litigation.</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">3.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Q3&#8217;24 pre-tax charge of $190&#160;million as a result of a restructuring action intended to streamline our organization, delivering efficiencies to enable reinvestment in our business to support the realization of our long-term growth opportunities. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">Other Notes</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">4.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Represents the translational and transactional impact of currency and the related impact of the Company&#8217;s foreign exchange derivative contracts designated as cash flow hedging instruments (specifically those that manage the impact of foreign currency variability on anticipated revenues and expenses).</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="text-indent:18pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="height:49.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">Note&#58;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Tables may not sum due to rounding.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;padding-left:27pt;text-indent:-27pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">**&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Not applicable</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">Gains and Losses on Equity Investments</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">1.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Year-to-date 2024 and 2023 pre-tax net losses of $69 million and $95 million, respectively, were primarily related to unrealized fair market value adjustments on marketable and nonmarketable equity securities. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:13.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">Year-to-date Special Items</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">2.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Year-to-date 2024 pre-tax charges of $400 million were primarily as a result of a change in estimate related to the claims of merchants who opted out of the U.S. merchant class litigation, settlements with a number of U.K. merchants and a legal provision associated with the ATM non-discrimination rule surcharge complaints.</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">3.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Year-to-date 2024 pre-tax charge of $190&#160;million as a result of a restructuring action intended to streamline our organization, delivering efficiencies to enable reinvestment in our business to support the realization of our long-term growth opportunities. </font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">4.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Year-to-date 2023 pre-tax charges of $231 million were primarily as a result of a change in estimate related to the claims of merchants who opted out of the U.S. merchant class litigation.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:13.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">Other Notes</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">5.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Represents the translational and transactional impact of currency and the related impact of the Company&#8217;s foreign exchange derivative contracts designated as cash flow hedging instruments (specifically those that manage the impact of foreign currency variability on anticipated revenues and expenses). style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">APMEA &#61; Asia Pacific &#47; Middle East &#47; Africa</font></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="69" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">Note that the figures in the preceding tables may not sum due to rounding&#59; growth represents change from the comparable year ago period.</font></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:100.000%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.087%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.087%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.526%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"><div><img alt="mclogoa03a.jpg" src="mclogoa03a.jpg" style="height:21px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:34px"></div></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><div style="text-align:right"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">13</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><div id="i037ebf294b804c618b812f68ad5038ff_19"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:54pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Footnote</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">The tables set forth the gross dollar volume (&#8220;GDV&#8221;), purchase volume, cash volume and the number of purchase transactions, cash transactions and cards on a regional and global basis for Mastercard&#8482;-branded cards. Growth rates over prior periods are provided for volume-based data.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">Debit transactions on Maestro&#174;&#160;and Cirrus&#174;-branded cards and transactions involving brands other than Mastercard are not included in the preceding tables.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">For purposes of the table&#58; GDV represents purchase volume plus cash volume and includes the impact of balance transfers and convenience checks&#59; &#8220;purchase volume&#8221; means the aggregate dollar amount of purchases made with Mastercard-branded cards for the relevant period&#59; and &#8220;cash volume&#8221; means the aggregate dollar amount of cash disbursements and includes the impact of balance transfers and convenience checks obtained with Mastercard-branded cards for the relevant period. The number of cards includes virtual cards, which are Mastercard-branded payment accounts that do not generally have physical cards associated with them.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">The Mastercard payment products are comprised of credit, charge, debit and prepaid programs, and data relating to each type of program is included in the tables. The tables include information with respect to transactions involving Mastercard-branded cards that are not switched by Mastercard and transactions for which Mastercard does not earn significant revenues.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">Information denominated in U.S. dollars is calculated by applying an established U.S. dollar&#47;local currency exchange rate for each local currency in which Mastercard volumes are reported. These exchange rates are calculated on a quarterly basis using the average exchange rate for each quarter. Mastercard reports period-over-period rates of change in purchase volume and cash volume on the basis of local currency information, in order to eliminate the impact of changes in the value of currencies against the U.S. dollar in calculating such rates of change.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">The data set forth in the GDV, purchase volume, purchase transactions, cash volume and cash transactions columns is provided by Mastercard customers and is subject to verification by Mastercard and partial cross-checking against information provided by Mastercard&#8217;s transaction switching systems. The data set forth in the cards columns is provided by Mastercard customers and is subject to certain limited verification by Mastercard. A portion of the data set forth in the cards columns reflects the impact of routine portfolio changes among customers and other practices that may lead to over counting of the underlying data in certain circumstances. All data is subject to revision and amendment by Mastercard or Mastercard&#8217;s customers. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">Performance information for prior periods can be found in the Investor Relations section of the Mastercard website at investor.mastercard.com.</font></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:100.000%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.087%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.087%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.526%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"><div><img alt="mclogoa03a.jpg" src="mclogoa03a.jpg" style="height:21px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:34px"></div></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><div style="text-align:right"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">14</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div></body></html>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

</table></div>
</div></td></tr>

// Edgar(tm) Renderer was created by staff of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.  Data and content created by government employees within the scope of their employment are not subject to domestic copyright protection. 17 U.S.C. 105.
var Show={};Show.LastAR=null,Show.showAR=function(a,r,w){if(Show.LastAR)Show.hideAR();var e=a;while(e&&e.nodeName!='TABLE')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e||e.nodeName!='TABLE'){var ref=((window)?w.document:document).getElementById(r);if(ref){e=ref.cloneNode(!0);
e.removeAttribute('id');a.parentNode.appendChild(e)}}
if(e)e.style.display='block';Show.LastAR=e};Show.hideAR=function(){Show.LastAR.style.display='none'};Show.toggleNext=function(a){var e=a;while(e.nodeName!='DIV')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e.style){}else if(!e.style.display){}else{var d,p_;if(e.style.display=='none'){d='block';p='-'}else{d='none';p='+'}
e.style.display=d;if(a.textContent){a.textContent=p+a.textContent.substring(1)}else{a.innerText=p+a.innerText.substring(1)}}}
</TEXT>

<TEXT>
/* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */

/* DefRef Styles */
..report table.authRefData{
	background-color: #def;
	border: 2px solid #2F4497;
	font-size: 1em;
	position: absolute;
}

..report table.authRefData a {
	display: block;
	font-weight: bold;
}

..report table.authRefData p {
	margin-top: 0px;
}

..report table.authRefData .hide {
	background-color: #2F4497;
	padding: 1px 3px 0px 0px;
	text-align: right;
}

..report table.authRefData .hide a:hover {
	background-color: #2F4497;
}

..report table.authRefData .body {
	height: 150px;
	overflow: auto;
	width: 400px;
}

..report table.authRefData table{
	font-size: 1em;
}

/* Report Styles */
..pl a, .pl a:visited {
	color: black;
	text-decoration: none;
}

/* table */
..report {
	background-color: white;
	border: 2px solid #acf;
	clear: both;
	color: black;
	font: normal 8pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	margin-bottom: 2em;
}

..report hr {
	border: 1px solid #acf;
}

/* Top labels */
..report th {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
	text-align: center;
}

..report th.void	{
	background-color: transparent;
	color: #000000;
	font: bold 10pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	text-align: left;
}

..report .pl {
	text-align: left;
	vertical-align: top;
	white-space: normal;
	width: 200px;
	white-space: normal; /* word-wrap: break-word; */
}

..report td.pl a.a {
	cursor: pointer;
	display: block;
	width: 200px;
	overflow: hidden;
}

..report td.pl div.a {
	width: 200px;
}

..report td.pl a:hover {
	background-color: #ffc;
}

/* Header rows... */
..report tr.rh {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
}

/* Calendars... */
..report .rc {
	background-color: #f0f0f0;
}

/* Even rows... */
..report .re, .report .reu {
	background-color: #def;
}

..report .reu td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

/* Odd rows... */
..report .ro, .report .rou {
	background-color: white;
}

..report .rou td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

..report .rou table td, .report .reu table td {
	border-bottom: 0px solid black;
}

/* styles for footnote marker */
..report .fn {
	white-space: nowrap;
}

/* styles for numeric types */
..report .num, .report .nump {
	text-align: right;
	white-space: nowrap;
}

..report .nump {
	padding-left: 2em;
}

..report .nump {
	padding: 0px 0.4em 0px 2em;
}

/* styles for text types */
..report .text {
	text-align: left;
	white-space: normal;
}

..report .text .big {
	margin-bottom: 1em;
	width: 17em;
}

..report .text .more {
	display: none;
}

..report .text .note {
	font-style: italic;
	font-weight: bold;
}
